emailpro_tab_domain_modify_domain_toolti:
The Vade Secure anti-spam solution is compatible with non-authoritative mode (only if your POP/IMAP accounts are hosted by OVH). If this is the case, we recommend using: {0}, {1}, {2} and {3}

If you are using non-authoritative mode with email accounts that are not hosted by OVH, you will need to use: {4} (see the associated domains section)
emailpro_tab_domain_mode_NON_AUTHORITATI: Non-authoritative mode (Email Pro + another email service)
emailpro-mxplan_tab_domain_mode_NON_AUTH: Non-authoritative mode (MX Plan email + another email service)
emailpro_tab_domain_AUTHORITATIVE_info: Authoritative mode means you cannot use another email service with Email Pro accounts. This mode enables Vade Secure anti-spam activation.
emailpro-mxplan_tab_domain_AUTHORITATIVE: Authoritative mode means you cannot use another email service with MX Plan email accounts. This mode enables Vade Secure anti-spam activation.
emailpro_tab_domain_NON_AUTHORITATIVE_in: In non-authoritative mode, you can use Email Pro with another email service. Vade Secure anti-spam is only compatible if the POP/IMAP accounts are hosted at OVH (MX Plan or hosted service). In this instance, you will need to enter mx1.mail.ovh.net as the target email server.
emailpro-mxplan_tab_domain_NON_AUTHORITA: In non-authoritative mode, you can use MX Plan with another email service. Vade Secure anti-spam is only compatible if the POP/IMAP accounts are hosted at OVH (MX Plan or hosted service). In this instance, you will need to enter mx1.mail.ovh.net as the target email server.
emailpro_tab_domain_modify_title: Are you sure you want to change the following domain for your Email Pro service?
emailpro-mxplan_tab_domain_modify_title: Are you sure you want to modify the following domain on your MX Plan service?
emailpro_tab_domain_modify_wizard_text:
By default, when you add your domain to the Email Pro server, it is configured in authoritative mode. This means that when you send an email to the address of the domain managed on the server, it will only check if the address is present on the Email Pro server.

On the other hand, if you switch the domain to non-authoritative mode, when an email is sent, we will check first of all whether the email address is present on the Email Pro server. If not, then the server will relay your email to the MX server you have defined.

You can use the domain in non-authoritative mode if you are looking to manage part of your emails on Email Pro, and another part on an external server, for example.

Important: Please note that if you want to use the Email Pro service with another email service hosted by OVH, you will need to enter the following value into the “Target email server” section of the form on the left-hand side: mx1.ovh.net.
emailpro-mxplan_tab_domain_modify_wizard:
By default, when you add your domain to the MX Plan server, it is configured in authoritative mode. This means that when you send an email to the address of the domain managed on the server, it will only check if the address is present on the MX Plan server.

On the other hand, if you switch the domain to non-authoritative mode, when an email is sent, we will check first of all whether the email address is present on the MX Plan email server. If not, then the server will relay your email to the MX server you have defined.

You can use the domain in non-authoritative mode if you are looking to manage part of your emails on MX Plan email, and another part on an external server, for example.

Important: Please note that if you want to use the MX Plan service with another email service hosted by OVH, you will need to enter the following value into the “Target email server” section of the form on the left-hand side: mx1.ovh.net.

emailpro_ACTION_configure_help_complexit:
This security setting determines whether passwords must meet complexity requirements
If this policy is enabled, passwords must meet the following minimum requirements when they are changed or created:
  • Does not contain all or part of the user's account name
  • Is at least 6 characters long
  • Contains characters from three of the following four categories:
    1. Uppercase characters from the English alphabet (A to Z)
    2. Lowercase characters from the English alphabet (a to z)
    3. Base 10 digits (0 to 9)
    4. Non-alphanumeric characters (for example, !, $, #, %)
Complexity requirements are enforced when passwords are changed or created.
emailpro_ACTION_configure_help_lockoutDu:
This security setting determines the number of minutes during which an account remains locked before it is automatically unlocked. The available lockout durations range from 1 to 90 minutes.
If the lockout threshold for an account is defined, the lockout duration for accounts must be equal to or greater than the reset duration.
emailpro_ACTION_configure_help_lockoutOb:
This security setting determines the number of minutes that must pass after an unsuccessful login attempt, for the login attempt counter to be reset. The available lockout durations range from 1 to 90 minutes.
If the lockout threshold for an account is defined, the time period before the counter is reset must be equal to or less than the lockout duration.
emailpro_ACTION_configure_help_lockoutTh: This security setting determines the number of unsuccessful login attempts that trigger a user account lockout. A locked account cannot be used until it is reset by an administrator, or until the account’s lockout duration period has passed. You can set a value between 1 and 14 unsuccessful session login attempts. If you set 0 as a value, the account will never lock.
emailpro_ACTION_configure_help_maxPasswo: This security setting determines the period of time (in days) during which a password can be used before the system prompts the user to change it. You can define this setting so that passwords expire after a number of days between 1 and 90, otherwise you can specify that passwords must never expire by defining the number of days as 0. If the maximum lifespan of a password is between 1 and 90 days, the minimum lifespan for passwords must be lower than their maximum duration. If the maximum lifespan for a password is set with 0 as a value, the the minimum duration can be defined with any value between 0 and 90 days.
emailpro_ACTION_configure_help_minPasswo: This setting determines the period of time (in days) during which a password can be used before the user can change it. You can define a value between 1 and 90 days, or otherwise you can immediately authorise modifications by setting the number of days as 0.

This security setting determines the minimum number of characters that a user account password must contain. You can define a value between 3 and 14 characters, or you can specify that a password is not required by defining the number of characters as 0.
emailpro_ACTION_configure_services_help_: If you enter "0", the account will never be locked.
If you enter "0", the password will always be valid.
If you enter "0", you will allow instant password changes.
If you enter "0", no password is required.

emailpro_dashboard_diag_a_tooltip_error:
If your domain is hosted by OVH, please create an A record by selecting the domain name concerned, then "Expert mode" -> "DNS zone" -> "Add a record". Enter:
Record type: A
Sub-domain: {0}
Target: {1}

If your domain is hosted elsewhere, create the A record on the domain via your service provider’s management interface, and enter the same information provided above.
emailpro_dashboard_diag_aaaa_tooltip_err:
If your domain is hosted by OVH, please create an AAAA record by selecting the domain name concerned, then "Expert mode" -> "DNS zone" -> "Add a record". Enter:
Record type: AAAA
Sub-domain: {0}
Target: {1}

If your domain is hosted elsewhere, create the AAAA record on the domain via your service provider’s management interface, and enter the same information provided above.
